Articles.Content: Hello, could someone please post here a download for the NASA Mission mod folder, I accidentally deleted it and I don't feel like reinstalling the KSP.
You have to reinstall KSP. It would be illegal to just redistribute a part of KSP that big.
It should be in your deleted files folder. (Except you deleted it there, too)

Really? I didn't think it would be that big of a problem, haha. I must have deleted it a while ago, 20+years in my current game and I just now found out that I have no asteroids, so yeah it's not in my recycle bin. Is the Steam "Verify integrity" thingy gonna download it for me? And is it gonna mess with my current KSP setup?

> 
> Really? I didn't think it would be that big of a problem, haha. I must have deleted it a while ago, 20+years in my current game and I just now found out that I have no asteroids, so yeah it's not in my recycle bin. Is the Steam "Verify integrity" thingy gonna download it for me? And is it gonna mess with my current KSP setup?

If you're going to be messing around with the game files, I cannot emphasize enough that you should back up your saves.

If its NOT a Steam install, AND you kept a copy of the KSP installer .zip, just open up the .zip, navigate down into the GameData folder, highlite the NASA mission folder, and extract it into the same place in your KSP\_win folder.

> 
> If you're going to be messing around with the game files, I cannot emphasize enough that you should back up your saves.

I completely agree. Learned that lesson the hard way! +1 rep for you!
Steam fixed it and didn't mess anything up!
